alert.note: Alert for Gloucester (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Gloucester, southeastern Charles City, northwestern York, central James City, and northern Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 645 PM EDT... At 606 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from Norge to near Cabin Point. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Surry, College Of William And Mary, Norge, Scotland, Jamestown, Kings Point, Belroi, York River State Park, Croaker, Barlows Corner, Camp Peary, Spring Grove, Centerville, Ewell, Christensons Corner, Governors Land, Skimino, Allmondsville and Gwaltney Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
